page.title: 01IVYCHURCH AND BRENZETT
page.content: This area, in common with Rommney Marsh. is flat and crossed by drainage dykes although it is not quite as well drained as most of the marsh. Lane use is intensive farming and managed grassland. In the south west the A259 partly follows the Rhee Wall, the old coastal defence wall. With low density population the area contains two towns; Brenzett, on the busy junction of the A259, A2070 and B2080 sees much through traffic and has a mixture of cottages and poor housing. Th general feeling is of decline but curiously neat to the old school house is a Rolls Royce showroom. Ivychurch, a small but pretty ribbon development boasts a fine church and village inn. It has a mixture of older, poorer housing and new large detached houses with evidence of development of the latter.
